pageContext.title: In brief: Agritech startup bags $35m funding to grow India footprint
pageContext.content:
Ninjacart, a marketing and delivery platform for agricultural produce, has raised US$35 million in a series B round led by US-based Accel Partners and Switzerland-based Syngeta Ventures.

Source: Livemint

Current Ninjacart backers Accel India and Qualcomm Venture also joined the round, alongside new investors likeÂ South Korean Neoplux and Trifecta Capital.

The Bangalore-based startup will use the funding to enter 10 more cities in India, open over 200 distribution centers, and invest in better supply chain infrastructure.

To date, Ninjacart has raised over US$49 million.

seo.title: Ninjacart bags $35m in fresh funding to expand across India
seo.description: Ninjacart plans to enter 10 new cities.
